Asthma Plant.Where it is Found Locally: Commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions, including Asia and the Americas.
Asthma Plant.Medicinal Properties: Asthma Plant is known for its anti-asthmatic properties. It is used to relieve symptoms of asthma, bronchitis, and other respiratory conditions.
Asthma Plant.Clinical Usage: It is used in traditional medicine to make herbal preparations such as teas and decoctions for respiratory ailments. It helps to alleviate cough, wheezing, and chest congestion.

Avaram.Where it is Found Locally: Native to India and commonly found in Southern India.
Avaram.Medicinal Properties: Avaram has various medicinal properties, including antidiabetic, antimicrobial, and antioxidant effects. It is also known for its diuretic properties.
Avaram.Clinical Usage: Avaram leaves and flowers are used to make herbal infusions that are traditionally used to treat diabetes, skin diseases, and urinary disorders. It is also used as a natural remedy for digestive issues.

Balloon Vine.Where it is Found Locally: Found in various parts of India and other tropical regions.
Balloon Vine.Medicinal Properties: Balloon Vine is known for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. It is used to alleviate joint pain and inflammation.
Balloon Vine.Clinical Usage: In traditional medicine, Balloon Vine is used topically in the form of poultices or oils to relieve arthritis, rheumatism, and muscle pain. It may also be used for skin conditions.

Bellyache Bush (Green).Where it is Found Locally: Native to the Americas but has become naturalized in many tropical regions.
Bellyache Bush (Green).Medicinal Properties: Various parts of the plant have been used for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
Bellyache Bush (Green).Clinical Usage: It is used in traditional medicine to treat a range of ailments, including abdominal pain, constipation, and skin conditions. However, caution is advised, as some parts of the plant can be toxic.

Benghal Dayflower.Where it is Found Locally: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it is considered a weed in many parts of the world.
Benghal Dayflower.Medicinal Properties: It is used in traditional medicine for its diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
Benghal Dayflower.Clinical Usage: Benghal Dayflower is traditionally used to treat urinary disorders, including urinary tract infections. It may also be used to alleviate inflammation.

Big Caltrops.Where it is Found Locally: Native to warm temperate and tropical regions.
Big Caltrops.Medicinal Properties: It is known for its diuretic, aphrodisiac, and anti-inflammatory properties.
Big Caltrops.Clinical Usage: In traditional medicine, Big Caltrops is used to treat urinary and reproductive issues, including impotence and infertility. It is also used to enhance athletic performance.

Black-Honey Shrub.Where it is Found Locally: Native to tropical regions, it is often found in open grasslands.
Black-Honey Shrub.Medicinal Properties: It is used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
Black-Honey Shrub.Clinical Usage: Black-Honey Shrub is used in traditional medicine to treat pain and inflammation, including joint pain and headaches. It is also used for its mild laxative effect.

Bristly Wild Grape.Where it is Found Locally: Common in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in forests and hilly areas.
Bristly Wild Grape.Medicinal Properties: Bristly Wild Grape is known for its antioxidant properties.
Bristly Wild Grape.Clinical Usage: It is traditionally used to treat various ailments, including fever and skin disorders. The leaves and stem extracts are used for their medicinal benefits.

Butterfly Pea.Where it is Found Locally: Native to tropical regions in Asia.
Butterfly Pea.Medicinal Properties: Butterfly Pea is known for its antioxidant properties and is rich in anthocyanins.
Butterfly Pea.Clinical Usage: It is traditionally used to promote brain health, improve memory, and reduce stress and anxiety. The blue flowers are often used to make herbal teas and beverages.

Cape Gooseberry.Where it is Found Locally: Native to South America but cultivated in various regions.
Cape Gooseberry.Medicinal Properties: Cape Gooseberry is known for its high vitamin C content and antioxidant properties.
Cape Gooseberry.Clinical Usage: It is used in traditional medicine to boost the immune system, improve digestion, and treat respiratory conditions. The fruit is rich in nutrients and is consumed fresh or in jams and desserts.

Common Wireweed.Where it is Found Locally: Found in various parts of the world, especially in tropical and subtropical regions.
Common Wireweed.Medicinal Properties: Common Wireweed is known for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
Common Wireweed.Clinical Usage: It is traditionally used to treat conditions like fever, cough, and cold. The plant's leaves are used in herbal preparations to alleviate pain and inflammation.

Country Mallow.Where it is Found Locally: Native to India and commonly found in many other Asian countries.
Country Mallow.Medicinal Properties: Country Mallow is known for its anti-inflammatory and diuretic properties.
Country Mallow.Clinical Usage: It is traditionally used to treat respiratory conditions such as bronchitis and asthma. The plant's roots and leaves are used in herbal remedies to alleviate cough and throat irritation.

Crown Flower.Where it is Found Locally: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, commonly found in India and Southeast Asia.
Crown Flower.Medicinal Properties: Crown Flower is known for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. It also has potential wound-healing properties.
Crown Flower.Clinical Usage: Various parts of the plant are used in traditional medicine to treat skin conditions, fever, and gastrointestinal issues. The latex from the plant may be applied to wounds and cuts.

Green Chireta.Local Name: Green Chireta, Kalmegh, King of Bitters
Green Chireta.Where it is Found Locally: Native to South Asian countries, including India.
Green Chireta.Medicinal Properties: Green Chireta is known for its strong bitterness and has anti-inflammatory and immunomodulatory properties.
Green Chireta.Clinical Usage: It is widely used in traditional Ayurvedic and herbal medicine to boost the immune system, treat fevers, and support liver health. It is also used for its anti-malarial properties.

Holy Basil.Where it is Found Locally: Native to the Indian subcontinent but cultivated in many parts of the world.
Holy Basil.Medicinal Properties: Holy Basil is known for its adaptogenic, anti-inflammatory, and antimicrobial properties.
Holy Basil.Clinical Usage: Holy Basil is considered sacred in Hinduism and is used in traditional medicine for its various health benefits. It is used to reduce stress, boost the immune system, and treat respiratory conditions.

Indian CopperLeaf.Where it is Found Locally: Native to India and other parts of Asia.
Indian CopperLeaf.Medicinal Properties: Indian CopperLeaf is known for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. It also has potential wound-healing properties.
Indian CopperLeaf.Clinical Usage: It is traditionally used to treat skin conditions, rheumatic pain, and respiratory issues. The leaves and roots are used in various herbal preparations.

Indian Jujube.Where it is Found Locally: Native to South Asia and widely cultivated in arid regions.
Indian Jujube.Medicinal Properties: Indian Jujube is known for its nutritional value, including vitamins and minerals.
Indian Jujube.Clinical Usage: The fruit is consumed for its nutritional benefits, and various parts of the plant are used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.

Indian Sarsaparilla.Where it is Found Locally: Native to India and other parts of Asia.
Indian Sarsaparilla.Medicinal Properties: Indian Sarsaparilla is known for its anti-inflammatory and diuretic properties.
Indian Sarsaparilla.Clinical Usage: It is used traditionally to purify the blood, treat skin conditions, and support the respiratory system. The root is commonly used in herbal preparations.

Indian Stinging Nettle.Where it is Found Locally: Found in various parts of India and other regions.
Indian Stinging Nettle.Medicinal Properties: Indian Stinging Nettle is known for its anti-inflammatory properties.
Indian Stinging Nettle.Clinical Usage: The leaves of the Indian Stinging Nettle are traditionally used to treat arthritis, joint pain, and skin conditions. It is also considered a nutritious vegetable.

Indian Thornapple.Where it is Found Locally: Native to South Asia and commonly found in India.
Indian Thornapple.Medicinal Properties: Indian Thornapple contains alkaloids with potential medicinal properties, but it is toxic and should be used with caution.
Indian Thornapple.Clinical Usage: In traditional medicine, various parts of the plant have been used in limited quantities to induce sedation, relieve pain, and treat respiratory conditions. However, it is highly toxic and not recommended for self-medication.

Indian Wormwood.Where it is Found Locally: Native to India and other parts of Asia.
Indian Wormwood.Medicinal Properties: Indian Wormwood is known for its potential anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
Indian Wormwood.Clinical Usage: It is used traditionally to treat digestive disorders, including indigestion and gas. The leaves and aerial parts of the plant are used in herbal remedies.

Ivy Gourd.Where it is Found Locally: Native to India but cultivated in many other tropical regions.
Ivy Gourd.Medicinal Properties: Ivy Gourd is known for its nutritional value and potential anti-diabetic properties.

Kokilaksha.Where it is Found Locally: Native to India and found in other parts of Asia.
Kokilaksha.Medicinal Properties: Kokilaksha is known for its potential aphrodisiac and diuretic properties.
Kokilaksha.Clinical Usage: It is traditionally used to improve sexual health, enhance libido, and support urinary health. The plant's seeds and roots are used in herbal preparations.

Land Caltrops (Bindii).Where it is Found Locally: Native to warm temperate and tropical regions.
Land Caltrops (Bindii).Medicinal Properties: Land Caltrops is known for its diuretic, aphrodisiac, and anti-inflammatory properties.
Land Caltrops (Bindii).Clinical Usage: It is used traditionally to treat urinary and reproductive issues, including impotence and infertility. It is also used to enhance athletic performance.

Madagascar Periwinkle.Where it is Found Locally: Native to Madagascar but cultivated worldwide.
Madagascar Periwinkle.Medicinal Properties: Madagascar Periwinkle contains alkaloids with potential medicinal properties.
Madagascar Periwinkle.Clinical Usage: It is known for its use in cancer treatment due to its alkaloids vincristine and vinblastine, which have anti-cancer properties. Additionally, it has been used in traditional medicine for diabetes and high blood pressure.

Madras Pea Pumpkin.Where it is Found Locally: Native to India and other parts of Asia.
Madras Pea Pumpkin.Medicinal Properties: Madras Pea Pumpkin is known for its nutritional value and potential diuretic properties.

Mexican Mint.Clinical Usage: In traditional medicine, it is used to alleviate digestive discomfort, reduce anxiety, and promote relaxation. It is also used to flavor foods and beverages.

Mexican Prickly Poppy.Medicinal Properties: Mexican Prickly Poppy contains alkaloids with potential medicinal properties.
Mexican Prickly Poppy.Clinical Usage: In traditional medicine, it has been used for pain relief, as a sedative, and for skin conditions. However, caution is advised as it can be toxic if not used properly.

Mountain Knotgrass.Where it is Found Locally: Found in various parts of India and other tropical regions.
Mountain Knotgrass.Medicinal Properties: Mountain Knotgrass is known for its potential diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
Mountain Knotgrass.Clinical Usage: It is traditionally used to treat urinary tract infections, kidney stones, and digestive disorders. The aerial parts of the plant are used in herbal preparations.

Night-Blooming Cereus.Local Name: Night-Blooming Cereus, Queen of the Night
Night-Blooming Cereus.Where it is Found Locally: Native to Mexico and other parts of Central America.

Panicled Foldwing.Medicinal Properties: Panicled Foldwing is known for its potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
Panicled Foldwing.Clinical Usage: It is traditionally used in herbal remedies for various purposes, including digestive health, fever, and pain relief. The aerial parts of the plant are used in preparations.

Prickly Chaff Flower.Medicinal Properties: Prickly Chaff Flower is known for its potential anti-inflammatory and diuretic properties.

Purple Tephrosia.Medicinal Properties: Purple Tephrosia is known for its potential hepatoprotective (liver-protecting) and anti-inflammatory properties.
Purple Tephrosia.Clinical Usage: It is used in traditional medicine for liver disorders, jaundice, and as a general health tonic. The whole plant is used in herbal preparations.

Rosary Pea.Where it is Found Locally: Native to tropical and subtropical regions, found in Asia, Africa, and the Americas.
Rosary Pea.Medicinal Properties: Rosary Pea contains toxic compounds and should be used with extreme caution. The seeds contain abrin, a highly toxic protein.
Rosary Pea.Clinical Usage: While it has been used traditionally for certain medicinal purposes, it is important to note that ingesting the seeds can be lethal and should be avoided.

Shaggy Button Weed.Where it is Found Locally: Native to North and South America.

Spiderwisp.Clinical Usage: It is used in traditional medicine for its various benefits, including treating skin conditions, fever, and digestive issues. Different parts of the plant are used in herbal remedies.

Square-Stalked Vine.Medicinal Properties: Square-Stalked Vine is primarily known as an edible plant and is not widely recognized for medicinal properties.
Square-Stalked Vine.Clinical Usage: The fruit is often consumed as a vegetable and is used in culinary dishes, but it is not commonly used for medicinal purposes.

Stinking Passionflower.Where it is Found Locally: Native to the Americas and naturalized in other tropical regions.

Tinnevelly Senna.Clinical Usage: It is widely used in herbal remedies and commercial laxative products to relieve constipation and promote bowel movements. It should be used with caution and under guidance.
